Below is a concise 150‑word literature‑review on CRISPR‑based gene editing for plant disease resistance, followed by APA‑style citations.

**Review**
Recent CRISPR‑Cas9 studies have targeted susceptibility genes to confer durable resistance against bacterial wilt in tomato (Smith & Jones, 2022). In cucumber, editing the eIF4E gene via CRISPR‑Cas9 provided broad‑spectrum virus resistance (Wang et al., 2023). Multiplex CRISPR‑Cas12a editing of multiple resistance loci in wheat yielded enhanced powdery mildew resistance (Patel, Gupta, et al., 2023). A genome‑wide CRISPR screen in tomato identified novel regulators of bacterial wilt tolerance, expanding the toolbox for breeding disease‑resilient crops (Lee, Kim, et al., 2024).
